capm-certification.title: Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM®) Certification

content.description: The Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM®) from the Project Management Institute (PMI) is an entry-level certification for aspiring project managers or team members who want to enhance their project management skills.

qualifications.intro: To qualify for the CAPM®, you need:
qualifications.experience: A secondary school degree, or high school diploma. No project experience is required.
qualifications.exam: Pass a PMI-arranged examination of 150 questions to be covered in 180 minutes. 95% of those who train with us pass this exam the first time they take it!

benefits.intro: Earning the CAPM® demonstrates your understanding of core project management concepts, tools, and processes outlined in PMI’s Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide). It is beneficial for:
lists: Increasing job opportunities by showcasing commitment to professional growth.
Gaining a strong foundation to prepare for more advanced certifications, like the PMP®.

content.salary: CAPM® holders can earn an average annual salary of $65,000 to $90,000, depending on their role, industry, and location. The certification can open doors to positions such as project coordinator, team lead, or junior project manager.
content.last: Start your project management career with the CAPM and set yourself apart in today’s competitive job market!

content.description: The Project Management Professional (PMP®) certification, offered by the Project Management Institute (PMI), is a globally recognized credential for experienced project managers.

qualifications.intro: To qualify for the PMP®, you need:
qualifications.experience: A 4-year bachelors degree with 3-5 years of project management experience within the past 8 years.
qualifications.education: 35 hours of project management training, or hold a CAPM® certification.
qualifications.exam: Pass a PMI-arranged examination of 180 questions to be covered in 230 minutes. 95% of those who train with us pass this exam on their first attempt!

benefits.intro: Some of the benefits of the PMP® certification includes:
lists: Credibility: Validates your expertise and sets you apart in a competitive job market.
Increased Earning Potential: PMP®-certified professionals earn 20% more on average than non-certified peers.
Global Recognition: Respected by employers worldwide, opening doors to international opportunities.
Enhanced Skills: Provides advanced tools and techniques to drive successful project outcomes.

content.salary: PMP® certification significantly boosts earning potential. According to PMI’s Earning Power: Project Management Salary Survey (12th Edition), PMP® holders earn a median salary of $123,000 annually in the United States, with similar trends in Canada and Europe.
content.ready: Invest in your future with the PMP® certification and join a global community of top-performing project managers!

content.description: The Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP®) certification validates your expertise in agile principles, methodologies, and frameworks.

qualifications.intro: To qualify for the PMI®, you need:
qualifications.experience: A secondary school degree, or high school diploma. Two years of agile experience within the last 5 years.
qualifications.education: 28 hours of PMI-ACP® training in agile practices.
qualifications.exam: Pass a PMI-arranged examination of 120 questions to be covered in 180 minutes. 95% of those who train with us pass this exam on their first try!

benefits.intro: Some of the benefits of the (PMI-ACP®) certification includes:
lists: Global Recognition: Establishes your expertise in agile approaches, making you a sought-after professional in the global job market.
Career Growth: Boosts your qualifications for agile project management roles across industries.
Versatility: Demonstrates your adaptability to work with diverse agile frameworks, enhancing your value to organizations.

content.salary: According to industry surveys, PMI-ACP®-certified professionals earn 10-25% higher salaries than their non-certified peers. The average annual salary ranges between $100,000 and $130,000, depending on your location, experience, and job role.
content.last: Whether you're looking to advance your career in project management or take on leadership roles in agile environments, the PMI-ACP® is an excellent investment in your professional development.
